intro: Montanoa hibiscifolia, commonly known as the Mexican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that resemble those of the hibiscus, typically in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Montanoa hibiscifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
